page.title: 09GEORGE ELIOT HOSPITAL
page.content: The name is taken from the famous 19th Century novelist.The original buildings were a workhouse,but these were rebuilt in 1809 by French prisoners of war.The Poyser block was added during the 1890's,and more buildings in 1939 in anticipation of casualties from bombing raids.These buildings are only now being replaced by modern blocks with new wards.It is an acute unit hospital with 390 beds,and does not deal with emergencies.The maternity hospital on the same site has 99 beds.Names of wards are taken from Eliot's novels e.g.Amos Barton,Lydgate,Janet and Dorothea.Nurses uniforms-Student,white with yellow;S.R.N.,white with green; Staff Nurse,white with blue;Sister, blue with blue belt,white hat. A computer is now used to assist with administration work.
